meanings.definition: A large herbivorous dinosaur with a long neck and tail, small head, and four thick legs.
meanings.sent1: The sauropod roamed the ancient lands, munching on leaves from tall trees.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the bones of sauropods to learn more about these ancient creatures.
meanings.sent3: The sauropod tried to play hide-and-seek, but its long neck always gave it away.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like that of a sauropod, steady and unwavering.
meanings.sent5: Children gasped in awe as the sauropod puppet moved its long neck and tail on stage.

meanings.definition: A member of the Sauropoda group of dinosaurs.
meanings.sent1: The museum exhibit showcased a fossilized sauropod among other dinosaur species.
meanings.sent2: Paleontologists have discovered new species of sauropods in different parts of the world.
meanings.sent3: The sauropod in the dinosaur parade waved to the crowd with its tiny head.
meanings.sent4: She stood tall and proud like a sauropod among her classmates.
meanings.sent5: The silhouette of the sauropod against the setting sun was a breathtaking sight.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of sauropods.
meanings.sent1: The sauropod features in the movie were created using advanced CGI technology.
meanings.sent2: The sauropod exhibit at the museum displayed detailed information about these dinosaurs.
meanings.sent3: Her room was decorated with sauropod-themed posters and toys.
meanings.sent4: The slow, sauropod pace of the tortoise amused the onlookers.
meanings.sent5: The mountain range had a sauropod-like majesty that left visitors speechless.
